verses.roman:
yadaiva kṛṣṇaḥ sandiṣṭaḥ
pārthānāṁ paramādbutam
kārayām āsa nagaraṁ
vicitraṁ viśvakarmaṇā

synonyms: yadā eva—when; kṛṣṇaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; sandiṣṭaḥ—requested; pārthānām—for the sons of Pṛthā; parama—most; adbhutam—amazing; kārayām āsa—He had constructed; nagaram—a city; vicitram—full of variety; viśvakarmaṇā—by Viśvakarmā, the architect of the demigods.
translation: [Describing a previous incident, Śukadeva Gosvāmī said:] Upon the request of the Pāṇḍavas, Lord Kṛṣṇa had Viśvakarmā build them a most wonderful and amazing city.

purport.content: Śrīla Viśvanātha Cakravartī mentions that this city was constructed before the burning of the Khāṇḍava forest and hence before the Lord found His bride Kālindī.
